required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine Cardiovascular Safety in Pediatric Burn Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Safety of Dexmedetomidine in Pediatric Burn Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: Dexmedetomidine is a sedative drug approved for adult patients, intubated, in intensive care units. We are studying whether this drug is cardiovascularly safe in pediatric patients who have recently been burned.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an ascending dose study evaluating the cardiovascular safety of dexmedetomidine bolus/infusions in acutely burned pediatric patients. The study entails a bolus of dexmedetomidine, followed by 2 hours of increasing infusion doses. Cardiovascular parameters including EKG, heart rate, oxygen saturation, blood pressure, are recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
primary_outcome.description: Looking at hemodynamic response to dexmedetomidine. Mean arterial pressure primary outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of arrhythmias was studied using a 3 lead realtime EKG throughout study.
Pulse oximetry was used to measure oxygen saturation.
Heart Rate recorded off EKG in beats per minute

arm_group.description: Ascending doses of dexmedetomidine (as per protocol)

intervention.description: Dexmedetomidine bolus 1 ug/kg over 10 minutes, followed by ascending infusion as follows: Dexmedetomidine [in ug/kg/hr], each for 15 minutes: 0.7, 1.0, 1.3, 1.6, 1.9, 2.2, 2.5.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pediatric patient
- >25% total body surface area (tbsa) burn and < 90% tbsa
- opioid requirements > 0.1 mg/kg/hour of morphine (or equivalent)
- midazolam requirement > 0.1 mg/kg/hour
- treatment team determined that patient should be started on dexmedetomidine
Exclusion Criteria:
- hemodynamically unstable patients (epinephrine > 1.0 ug/kg/min, levophed > 0.75 ug/kg/min, dopamine > 10 ug/kg/min)
- pregnant patients
- patients with history of heart block
- patients with congenital heart disease
- patients with significant hepatic dysfunction
- patients with urine output < 0.5 ml/kg/hour [averaged] over past 24 hours

group.title: Cohort 1: Dexmedetomidine Bolus 1 mcg/kg Over 10 Min IV
group.description: All participants received a dexmedetomidine bolus of 1.0 micrograms (mcg) per kilogram over 10 minutes.

group.title: Cohort 2: Dexmedetomidine 0.7 mcg/kg/hr Infusion
group.description: This group received the bolus dose and a continuous infusion for 15 minutes of 0.7 mcg/kg/hr of dexmedetomidine. This group is a subset of Cohort 1 that continued in this ascending dose study.

group.title: Cohort 3: Dexmedetomidine 1.0 mcg/kg/hr Infusion
group.description: This group received the bolus dose, followed by dexmedetomidine infusion for 15 minutes at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr, followed by 1.0 mcg/kg/hr infusion for 15 minutes. This is a subset of cohort 2.

group.title: Cohort 4: Dexmedetomidine Infusion 1.3 mcg/kg/hr
group.description: This group received the bolus dose followed by the ascending infusion first at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, then 1.0 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, the 1.3 mcg/kg.hr for 15 minutes. This group is a subset of cohort 3.

group.title: Cohort 5: Dexmedetomidine 1.6 mcg/kg/hr Infusion
group.description: This group received the bolus dose followed by the ascending infusion first at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, then 1.0 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, the 1.3 mcg/kg.hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.6 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes. This group is a subset of cohort 4.

group.title: Cohort 6: Dexmedetomidine 1.9 mcg/kg/hr
group.description: This group received the bolus dose followed by the ascending infusion first at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, then 1.0 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, the 1.3 mcg/kg.hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.6 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.9 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes. This group is a subset of cohort 5.

group.title: Cohort 7: Dexmedetomidine 2.2 mcg/kg/hr
group.description: This group received the bolus dose followed by the ascending infusion first at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, then 1.0 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, the 1.3 mcg/kg.hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.6 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.9 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, followed by 2.2 mcg/kg/hr over 15 minutes. This group is a subset of cohort 6.

group.title: Cohort 8: Dexmedetomidine 2.5 mcg/kg/hr
group.description: This group received the bolus dose followed by the ascending infusion first at 0.7 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, then 1.0 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, the 1.3 mcg/kg.hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.6 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, followed by 1.9 mcg/kg/hr for 15 minutes, followed by 2.2 mcg/kg/hr over 15 minutes, followed by 2.5 mcg/kg/hr over 15 minutes. This group is a subset of cohort 7.

participants_list.participants: One participant did not begin infusion due to hypotension (mean pressure <50)
2 participants did not begin the ascending (1.0 mcg/kg/hr) due to MAP<50
1 participant did not begin infusion due to hypotension (MAP<50)
2 participants did not begin this infusion due to hypotension (MAP<50)

group.title: Ascending Dose Study
group.description: Ascending doses of dexmedetomidine (as per protocol) Dexmedetomidine: Dexmedetomidine bolus 1 ug/kg over 10 minutes, followed by ascending infusion as follows: Dexmedetomidine [in ug/kg/hr], each for 15 minutes: 0.7, 1.0, 1.3, 1.6, 1.9, 2.2, 2.5.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Percent Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
outcome.description: Looking at hemodynamic response to dexmedetomidine. Mean arterial pressure primary outcome measure.
outcome.population: Acutely burned pediatric patients intubated with burns >=20% between 2 and 19 years of age requiring escalating doses of morphine and midazolam

group.title: Cohort 1: Dexmedetomidine Bolus 1 mcg/kg Over 10 Min IV

measure.title: Percent Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP)
measure.description: Looking at hemodynamic response to dexmedetomidine. Mean arterial pressure primary outcome measure.
measure.population: Acutely burned pediatric patients intubated with burns >=20% between 2 and 19 years of age requiring escalating doses of morphine and midazolam

outcome.title: Presence of Arrhythmias.
outcome.description: Presence of arrhythmias was studied using a 3 lead realtime EKG throughout study.
outcome.population: EKG was analyzed on each participant looking for presence of arrhythmias. None were detected.

group.title: Cohort 1: Dexmedetomidine Bolus 1 mcg/kg Over 10 Min IV
group.description: Ascending doses of dexmedetomidine (as per protocol) Dexmedetomidine: Dexmedetomidine bolus 1 ug/kg over 10 minutes, followed by ascending infusion as follows: Dexmedetomidine [in ug/kg/hr], each for 15 minutes: 0.7, 1.0, 1.3, 1.6, 1.9, 2.2, 2.5.

measure.title: Presence of Arrhythmias.
measure.description: Presence of arrhythmias was studied using a 3 lead realtime EKG throughout study.
measure.population: EKG was analyzed on each participant looking for presence of arrhythmias. None were detected.

outcome.title: Oxygen Saturation
outcome.description: Pulse oximetry was used to measure oxygen saturation.

event.sub_title: Significant hypotension defined as mean arterial pressure <50 mm Hg
event.description: Hypotension, defined as mean arterial pressure (MAP) < 50 millimeters of mercury, was considered an adverse event and would halt the ascending dose study for the subject.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
